titleStmt.title: Gadla Kiros “Vita of Kiros” / Malkǝʾa Kiros “Image of Kiros” (IV)

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

msContents.summary:
I) Gadla Kiros “Vita of Kiros” (fols. 3ra-33rb) II) Malkǝʾa Kiros “Image of Kiros” (IV) (fols. 34va-37rb)
Additiones 1-2.

msItem.title: I. Gadla Kiros “Vita of Kiros”
msItem.incipit: 3ra: በስመ፡”… ንዌጥን፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፨ ጽሒፈ፡ ገድሉ፡ ለብፁዕ፡ ወለቅዱስ፡ አቡነ፡ ኪሮስ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡…ወኮነ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘነበረ፡ ዲበ፡ መንበረ፡ አቡሁ፡ ዮናኒን፡ ወገብረ፡ ምግባራተ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወኢያንተገ፡ እምኔሁ፡ ወነበረ፡ ፷ዓመተ፡ ወወለደ፡ ወልደ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አብያ። ወአዕረፈ፡ በክብር፡ ወነበረ፡ አብያ፡ ዲበ፡ መንበረ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወገብረ፡ ምግባራተ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወኢያንተገ፡ እምኔሁ፡ ኢአሐተኒ። 3ra: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. We shall begin, with the help of God, writing the Vita of the blessed and holy our father Kiros. His prayer and blessing… And there was a man who sat on the throne of his father Yonanin and he did the deeds of his father and did not abandon that (duty); and he ruled for 60 years; and he begat a son whose name was ʾAbya. And he died in glory and ʾAbya sat on the throne of his father and he did the deeds of his father and did not abandon that (duty) not even one single time.
msItem.explicit: 33ra: ወጸገዎ፡ ዕሤተ፡ ትፍሥሕት፡ ዘተመነየ፡ ረከበ፡ ስብሐት፡ ለአብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፨ ዘይጼጉ፡ ክብረ፡ ለአግብርቲሁ፡ ዘበሰማይ፡ ወዘበምድር፡ ወተፅናስ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ኪሮስ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብሩ፡ ገብረ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ወምስለ፡ ጸሒፉ፡ ወልደ፡ ማርያም፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ 33ra: And he granted to him a reward of joy; (and) he received what he desired. Glory to the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit who grants honour to His servants in heaven and on the earth, and affliction. May prayers and blessings of our father Kiros be with his servant Gabra Giyorgis and with his scribe Walda Māryām, forever and ever, Amen.

listBibl.bibl: VatLib Comb 205 (19th/20th cent.), 5r-80r: “Atti di Kiros”; 80v-83v: “Effigie di Kiros”
“Vita des seligen und heiligen Abbā Kiros”
BritLib Orient. 701 (18th centr.), 2a-53a: “The Acts of Cyrus”, 53b-54: Hymn to Kiros
EMML n3554 (16th/17th centr., Church of Masāqo Śellāsē, Ḥarr Ambā, Ankobarr, Shoa), 1r-38v (EMML IX, 37),
EMML n319 (19th centr., Private library of Mamrē Baqala, district of Gafarsā, Addis Ababa), 1r-50v (EMML II, 21),
EMML n2107 (19th centr., Church of Miṭāq Takla Hāymānot, Tagulat and Bulgā, Shoa), I 67r-96v: “Gadla Abbā Kiros”; II 96r-98v: Malkǝʾa Kiros (EMML VI, 199),
EMML n2137 (19th centr., Church of Miṭāq Takla Hāymānot, Tagulat and Bulgā, Shoa), 1r-32v (EMML VI, 248),
EMML n3418 (19th/20th centr., Church of Karrayyo Takla Hāymānot, Gubbālāfto, Yağğu, Wallo), I 51r-65v: “Combat of Abbā Kiros”; II 65v: “salām” to the saint (EMML VIII, 252),
EMML n4683 (19th centr., Private library of Qēs Bakwra, Dabra Berhān, Shoa), 1r-38r (EMML X, 266).

note.p: Marrassini (2004:79-81, 83) refers to this version of the Vita of Kiros as the text of “type 1”, most commonly spread and contained in many Mss. It is different from the Vita of “type 2” which is attested in a few Mss. only (translated and published: B. Turaev, “Kopto-efiopskoe skazanie o prepodobnom Kire”, Zapiski vostočnago otdelenija I.R.Arhe­ologičeskago Obščestva 15, 1903, 1–14).

msItem.title: II. Malkǝʾa Kiros “Image of Kiros” (IV)
msItem.incipit: 34va: ሰላም፡ ለፅንሰትከ፡ ወለልደትከ፡ ልደተ፡ ዓርክ፨ እምቤተ፡ መንግሥት፡ ዘሮሜ፡ በትእዛዘ፡ አዚዝ፡ አማላክ፨ ኪሮስ፡ ዘሥጋ፡ ወዘመንፈሳዊ፡ መልአክ፨ ውስተ፡ ዓፀደ፡ ወይን፡ እትቀነይ፡ ስባሔከ፡ ለዘፈጠርኩ፡ በሠርክ፤ ዲናረ፡ በረከት፡ ሀበኒ፡ እመዝገብ፡ ቡሩክ፨ 34va: Salutation to your conception and your birth, (which is) the birth of a friend, (Who comes) from the royal house of Rome by the order of mighty God, Kiros, the angel in flesh and in spirit. In the vineyard I praise, with hymns, the One who created me at dusk. Give me a dinar as a gift from the blessed treasury!
msItem.explicit: 37rb: ዓቢየ፡ ዕበይ፡ ኪሮስ፡ እምጸወርተ፡ መንበር፡ እንስሳ፨ እስመ፡ እንተ፡ ጸዋሪሁ፡ ለወልደ፡ አምላክ፡ አንበሣ፨ መልአከ፡ ምሕረት{ከ}፡ ጸሎትከ፡ ይትፈነው፡ ለፈውሳ፨ 37rb. Kiros, the great in the greatness, among those who bear the throne, a (living) Creature, For the lion is a bearer of the Son of God. May the angel of mercy send your prayer for her cure!

BritLib Orient. 573 (late 17th centr.), 204a: Hymn to Kiros
BritLib Orient. 701 (18th centr.), 2a-53a: “The Acts of Cyrus”, 53b-54: Hymn to Kiros
EMML n2107 (19th centr., Church of Miṭāq Takla Hāymānot, Tagulat and Bulgā, Shoa), 67r-96v: “Gadla Abbā Kiros”; 96r-98v: Malkǝʾa Kiros (EMML VI, 199),
EMML n3418 (19th/20th centr., Church of Karrayyo Takla Hāymānot, Gubbālāfto, Yağğu, Wallo), 51r-65v: “Combat of Abbā Kiros”; 65v: “salām” to the saint (EMML VIII, 252),

note.p: The Mälkǝʾ differs from the text registered in ChRep (n61, 133, 141, 346) and the Mälkǝʾ and salām included in the Mss. mentioned above, and also from the Mälkǝʾ to Kiros included in the Gubaʾe mälkǝʾ (s., e.g., Mss. Brit Lib Orient. 573, Brit Lib Orient. 577, EMIP 20 – Marwick Codex 16 and EMIP 42 – Eliza Codex 17).

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 38.0 folios, of which blank 33v, 34r, 38r, in 5.0 quires (A+4).
195 145 21
supportDesc.condition: Some fols. are affected by humidity.

layout.ab: Pricking and ruling are partly visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: II. Nine dot asterisk (used throughout the text).
III. Chain of black and red dots (17v, 22v);
Two nine dot asterisks followed by three nine dot asterisks in the line below, between the chains of black and red dots (37r).

handDesc.handNote: Mediocre Black, red Walda MāryāmWalda Māryām (s. Additio 2, mentioned also on 3ra, 17vb, 33ra).Second half of the 19th century. Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist; names of the donors; groups of lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I; incipit of Text II; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist; names of the donors; groups of lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I; incipit of Text II; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

decoDesc.decoNote: 3r (incipit page of Text I): elaborate uncoloured ornamental band; interlaces; two pairs of the ailes and a cross on the top.

item.quote: 37rb.: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘጃ{ጃ}ዝት[sic] ጓንጕል᎓ ማሩ᎓ ወስመ᎓ ጥምቀቱ᎓ ገብረ᎓ ጊዮርጊስ᎓ ዘሠረቆ᎓ ወዘፈሐቆ᎓ ውጉዘ᎓ ለይኩን
37rb: This (is) the book of daǧǧāzmāč Gʷangʷǝl Maru whose baptismal name is Gabra Giyorgis. Anyone who has stolen (it) or erased (it’s text) shall be excommunicated.

item.desc: : Short prayer for the forgiveness of sins.
item.quote: 37r: ኦአምላከ፡ ኪሮስ፡ ሥረይ፡ ኃጢአትየ፡ ለገብርከ፡ ገብረ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ወለጸሐፊከ፡ ወልደ፡ ማርያም፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨
37rab: O God of Kiros, forgive sins of your servant Gabra Giyorgis and your scribe Walda Māryām, for ever and ever, Amen.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards (the front board is broken and carefully repaired with a leather cord); Two pairs of sawing stations.
Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Probably daǧǧāzmāč Gwangwǝl (Gwangul) Maru (a son of daǧǧāzmāč Maru who was a brother of King Yoḥannǝs IV, r. 1872-89) whose baptismal name was Gabra Giyorgis (s. Additio 1).

Gabra Māryām (mentioned in the supplication formulas, 3ra, 22vb, 25rb, 26va, 33ra, 37rb); later, however, the second part of the name was corrected to (Gabra) Giyorgis, in the same hand and in the same ink as Additio I. Gabra Giyorgis was the baptismal name of daǧǧāzmāč Gwangwǝl Maru.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
